intro: Cryptandra petraea, commonly known as the rock cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it resilient in harsh environments. Cryptandra petraea is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife and its use in horticulture.
